org.ingatan.component.image
Class ThumbnailPane

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  org.ingatan.component.image.ThumbnailPane
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
EraserOptionPane, LineOptionPane, PencilOptionPane
public class ThumbnailPane
extends javax.swing.JPanel

Displays a panel of thumbnails. Allows the user to make a selection.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Thomas Everingham
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

ThumbnailPane

public ThumbnailPane()
Creates a new ThumbnailPane with no images, size 48 squares, and a 5 column layout.

ThumbnailPane

public ThumbnailPane(int thumbnailSize)
Creates a new thumbnail pane with no images and a 5 column layout, and the specified sized thumbnails.

Parameters:
thumbnailSize - the required size of the thumbnails.

ThumbnailPane

public ThumbnailPane(int thumbnailSize,
                     int columns)
Creates a new thumbnail pane with no images, the specified column layout, and the specified sized thumbnails.

Parameters:
thumbnailSize - the required size of the thumbnails.

ThumbnailPane

public ThumbnailPane(javax.swing.ImageIcon[] thumbnails,
                     int thumbnailSize)
Creates a new thumbnail pane with the supplied images, at the specified thumbnail size. Default grid layout of 5 columns is used.

Parameters:
thumbnails - each image in this array is converted to a thumbnail and added to the pane.
thumbnailSize - the size of the thumbnail squares.

ThumbnailPane

public ThumbnailPane(javax.swing.ImageIcon[] thumbnails,
                     int thumbnailSize,
                     int columns)
Creates a new thumbnail pane with the supplied images at the specified thumbnail size and with the requested number of columns

Parameters:
thumbnails - each image in this array is converted to a thumbnail and added to the pane.
thumbnailSize - the size of the thumbnail squares.
columns - number of columns to use.
Method Detail

setThumbnailSize

public void setThumbnailSize(int size)
Sets the side length of the thumbnails; thumbnails are always square.

Parameters:
size - the side length of the thumbnails.

setThumbnails

public void setThumbnails(javax.swing.ImageIcon[] thumbnails)
Replaces the array of icons to use for this thumbnail pane.

Parameters:
thumbnails - the array of icons to use for this thumbnail pane.

clearThumbnails

public void clearThumbnails()
Clears all current images. This method will not update the interface. If you intend on adding thumbnails directly after clearing, then this will update the interface. If not, then use setThumbnails(new ImageIcon[0]).

appendThumbnails

public void appendThumbnails(javax.swing.ImageIcon[] thumbnails)
Adds all of the icons in the specified array to the end of the current array of icons.

Parameters:
thumbnails - the icons to append to this thumbnail pane.

addThumbnail

public void addThumbnail(javax.swing.ImageIcon thumbnail)
Adds the specified icon to the end of the current icon array.

Parameters:
thumbnail - the thumbnail to add to the end of the current icon array.

getThumbnails

public javax.swing.ImageIcon[] getThumbnails()
Gets the current array of icons encapsulated by this thumbnail pane.

Returns:
the current array of icons encapsulated by this thumbnail pane.

getThumbnail

public javax.swing.ImageIcon getThumbnail(int index)
Gets the thumbnail at the specified index.

Parameters:
index - the index of the required thumbnail.
Returns:
the thumbnail at the specified index.

replaceThumbnail

public void replaceThumbnail(int index,
                             javax.swing.ImageIcon newThumbnail)
Replaces the thumbnail at the specified index with the specified thumbnail.

Parameters:
index - the index of the thumbnail to replace.
newThumbnail - the new thumbnail to be placed at the specified index.

Gets the currently selected index.

Sets the currently selected index to that specified.

addThumbnailMouseListener

public void addThumbnailMouseListener(java.awt.event.MouseListener listener)
Adds a MouseListener to every thumbnail that exists or is subsequently added.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to add.

removeThumbnailMouseListener

public boolean removeThumbnailMouseListener(java.awt.event.MouseListener listener)
Remove this MouseListener from all existing thumbnails, and no longer add it to subsequent thumbnails.

Parameters:
listener - the listener to remove.
Returns:
true if the operation is successful, and false if the listener could not be found and hence not removed.

thumbnailSelectionChanged

protected void thumbnailSelectionChanged()
This method is called whenever the selected thumbnail is changed. It can be overridden so that extending classes may offer extra functionality.
